column2: It seems that the "other" gender group has a higher relative spend ratio (percentage of purchases vs percentage of group) than the other gender groups.
The "other" gender group also has a higher average spend than the other genders of the group. It might make sense for this company to target similar "other" audiences of their consumer market.

Females represent over 17% of the total player population but only represent 16% of spend. It might make sense to target males more heavily as well, because they are the larger target audience and they spend higher relative to females.
